questions: Why does Jira Assistant need access to all sites?
What is the reason for Jira Assistant requesting access to all sites?
Can you explain why Jira Assistant requires access to all the websites?
answer: As of JA v2.71, this is no longer an issue for Chrome users. JA can now be integrated with any Jira instance, requiring this permission. It's important because JA doesn't store your credentials; it directly connects to Jira using your browser's established authentication.

questions: What permissions does Jira Assistant need for integration?
Which permissions are required for Jira Assistant integration?
Can you explain the necessary permissions for integrating with Jira?
answer: Jira Assistant requires access to Jira in order to establish integration. It uses the authentication established by your browser for this purpose, so you don't need to provide additional credentials. This approach enhances security and simplifies the integration process.

questions: How can I troubleshoot network errors during Jira integration?
What should I do when encountering network errors while integrating with Jira?
Network errors are preventing me from integrating with Jira, what's the solution?
answer: When integrating with Jira, ensure you're logged in to Jira from your browser. Use the appropriate URL format, like http:// or https://. Provide the Jira base path, not page URLs. E.g., use https://jira.yourcompany.com, not https://jira.yourcompany.com/browse. Incorrect URLs can lead to network errors.

questions: How do I resolve frequent 401 Unauthenticated errors?
What steps should I take to fix the 401 Unauthenticated error?
I'm seeing 401 Unauthenticated errors despite authenticating with Jira, what should I do?
answer: Most importantly, ensure you're logged into Jira from the same browser. If you still face the issue, click 'Grant permission' on the 401 page in JA. Sometimes, JA's access to Jira is revoked, causing this error. For more details, check GitHub issue #214.

questions: I'm unable to authenticate even though I'm logged into Jira. What should I do?
Authentication is failing despite being logged in to Jira, what's the solution?
How can I troubleshoot authentication errors during Jira integration?
answer: Ensure you're logged in to Jira from the same browser. If authentication issues persist, contact the developer with a screenshot of the error or console details for assistance.

questions: I'm having trouble integrating with Jira. How can I resolve it?
Configuration issues prevent me from integrating with Jira. How can I fix them?
I'm encountering CORS errors during Jira integration. What should I do?
answer: Ensure you're authenticated with Jira on the same browser window. If CORS issues arise, upgrade your browser. If the problem persists, contact the developer for further support. Unfortunately, the exact cause of the CORS issue is not reproducible.

questions: Why can't I use JA with Firefox Multi Account containers?
Is JA incompatible with Firefox Multi Account containers?
Can you explain the issues with using JA in Firefox Multi Account containers?
answer: Firefox Multi Account containers are rarely used with JA, but they generally work for most users. However, specific users might face compatibility issues. The root cause is unknown, making it difficult to fix. For more details, refer to GitHub issue #103.

questions: Is Jira Assistant compatible with different web browsers?
Which web browsers are supported for integrating with Jira Assistant?
Can I use Jira Assistant across various web browsers?
answer: Yes, Jira Assistant is available as a browser extension for popular web browsers such as Chrome, Firefox, Edge, and Opera. You can install and use it on any of these browsers to seamlessly integrate with your Jira instance.

questions: Can I integrate Jira Assistant with multiple instances of Jira?
How do I connect Jira Assistant to more than one Jira instance?
Is it possible to switch between different Jira instances using Jira Assistant?
answer: Absolutely, Jira Assistant allows you to integrate with multiple Jira instances. After authenticating with Jira in your browser, you can easily switch between instances by clicking on the Jira domain name displayed in the extension's header. This feature provides seamless access to various Jira instances.
